fields.description: Optional media to display above the question.

semantics.label: Task description
semantics.description: Describe how the user should solve the task.
semantics.default: Drag the words into the correct boxes

semantics.label: Text
semantics.placeholder: *Oslo* is the capital of Norway, *Stockholm* is the capital of Sweden and *Copenhagen* is the capital of Denmark. All cities are located in the *Scandinavian:Northern Part of Europe* peninsula. Maths: *2\*3* = 6 and *12\:3* = 4

important.description:
• Tutorial and Examples: Papi Jo's Drupal test site
  • Droppable words are added with an asterisk (*) in front and behind the correct word/phrase.
  • Asterisks can be added within droppable words/phrases by escaping them (with a backslash), e.g. "6 = *2\*3*" => "2*3".
  • You may add a textual tip, using a colon (:) in front of the tip.
  • Colons can be added within droppable words/phrases by escaping them (with a backslash), e.g. "6 = *12\:3*" => "12:3".
  • For every empty spot there is only one correct word.
  • You may add feedback to be displayed when a task is completed. Use '\+' for correct and '\-' for incorrect feedback.

semantics.label: Distractors
semantics.description: Enter optional extra solutions that are wrong as distractors. Use the same asterisk (*) scheme as for the text.

fields.label: Define custom feedback for any score range
fields.description: Click the "Add range" button to add as many ranges as you need. Example: 0-20% Bad score, 21-91% Average Score, 91-100% Great Score!

semantics.label: Empty Drop Zone label
semantics.description: Label used for accessibility, where the Read speaker will read that the drop zone is empty

semantics.label: Contains Drop Zone label
semantics.description: Label used for accessibility, where the Read speaker will read that the drop zone contains a draggable

semantics.label: Draggable elements label
semantics.description: Label used for accessibility, where the Read speaker reads that this is a draggable element. Variable available: @index, @count

semantics.label: Label for show tip button
semantics.description: Label used for accessibility, where the Read speaker reads it before the tip is read out

Confirmation dialog description that user wants to reset a droppable
semantics.default: Are you sure you want to reset this drop zone?

Label used for accessibility, where the read speaker indicates that dragging is canceled
Label used for accessibility, where the read speaker indicates that a text is the correct answer
Header for panel containing feedback for correct/incorrect answers
Behavioural settings.
semantics.description: These options will let you control how the task behaves.

fields.label: Shorten the longish draggable texts
fields.description: Uncheck this option if you want to keep the original lengths of draggable texts.

fields.label: Sort the draggable texts in alphabetic order
fields.description: Check this option if you want to sort the draggable texts in alphabetic order (rather than randomized).

fields.label: Keep correct answers
fields.description: Check this option if you want to keep the draggable text elements dropped in the correct blanks after pressing 'Retry'.

fields.label: Display the correct and wrong feedback backgrounds transparent
fields.description: Check this option if you want to display the correct and incorrect draggable texts without a color background (and a check icon) upon checking the answers. Useful when the draggable elements are parts of words. Only available if the 'Shorten the longish draggable texts' option is disabled.

fields.label: Solutions below content
fields.description: If set, will force solution texts to be displayed below the content.

fields.label: Left Column Width
fields.description: You can optionally set the width of the left column (i.e. the text containg blanks). If in doubt, leave the 'auto' setting.

semantics.label: Textual representation of the score bar for those using a readspeaker
Assistive technology label for "Check" button
semantics.default: Check the answers. The responses will be marked as correct, incorrect, or unanswered.

semantics.label: Assistive technology label for "Show Solution" button
semantics.default: Show the solution. The task will be marked with its correct solution.

semantics.label: Assistive technology label for "Retry" button
semantics.default: Retry the task. Reset all responses and start the task over again.
